{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Ruckus Wireless |model=ZoneFlex R730 |revision=
(901-R730-WW00) |price=1695 |series=AX6000 |fcc_date=08/22/2018 |manuf_country=Singapore |is_manuf=No |availability=now |type=enterprise access point, IoT hub, mesh node |fcc_id=S9GR730 |ic_id=5912A-R730 |pwr_v=48 |pwr_amp=0.75 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_poe=at |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm |cpu1_model=IPQ8074A |cpu1_cspeed=2 GHz |cpu1_cores=4 |fla1=256 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model=NAND |ram1=512 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model=DDR3 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi1_chip1_model=QCN5154 |wi1_chip2_brand=Qualcomm |wi1_chip2_model=QCN5154 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac+ax |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=8 |wi1_rxchains=8 |wi1_sstreams=8 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi2_chip1_model=QCN5124 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn+ax |wi2_txchains=4 |wi2_rxchains=4 |wi2_sstreams=4 |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Aquantia |eth_chip2_model=AQR108 |sw_cpu= |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=1 |wan_speed=5GbE |wan_ports=1 |flags=Wi-Fi 6, WPA3, BeamFlex, Bluetooth, ZigBee, DFS (master), |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac+ax |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=super |default_pass=sp-admin |oui=EC:58:EA |oui_eth=EC:58:EA }}
:• '''1148''' Mbps - 4SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ax 802.11ax] (40MHz chan.) :• '''4800''' Mbps - 8SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ax 802.11ax] (80MHz chan.) = '''''AX6000'' class'''
{{TagLine|Indoor 802.11ax 8x8:8 Wi-Fi AP with 5Gbps Backhaul}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.ruckuswireless.com/products/access-points/ruckus-indoor/ruckus-r730}} {{•}} [https://data.kommago.nl/img/products/large/ruckus_zoneflex_r730_3.jpg Label] A peak PHY rate of 4.8Gbps for 5GHz 11ax is claimed on the product page. This speed is typically associated with four spatial streams and 160MHz channels but :FCC documents suggest that this device has an 8x8 mode with 80MHz channel width. FCC documents also suggest that device supports a 4x4 5GHz mode which could enable :tri-band support with four streams available to be dedicated to the "5Gbps backhaul" (mentioned on the specs page) used for mesh connections and four are used for clients. With previous-generation Qualcomm WiSoC, configuring as dual-band meant 2.4GHz :and 5GHz but this generation might support 2x 5GHz radios. ===News=== * [https://www.ruckuswireless.com/press/releases/20180717-new-ruckus-r730-first-iot-and-lte-ready-80211ax-access-point-stadiums-public ''Press Release'' at '''Ruckus Wireless'''] : Additional IoT protocol and LTE support can be added with modules. ===See also=== *[[Ruckus Wireless R750]] - AX3600 Indoor 802.11ax 4x4:4 Wi-Fi AP *[[Ruckus Wireless R730]] - AX6000 Indoor 802.11ax 8x8:8 Wi-Fi AP *[[Ruckus Wireless ZoneFlex R720]] - Dual Band 802.11ac Wave 2 Access Point :(4x4:4 ac, 3x3:3 n, MIMO, BeamFlex, WPA3) • [http://certifications.prod.wi-fi.org/pdf/certificate/public/download?cid=WFA73327 WFA73327] (2019-02-20) *[[Ruckus Wireless ZoneFlex R710]] - Dual Band 802.11ac Wave 2 Access Point :(4x4:4 MIMO, BeamFlex, Dual Ports, 802.3af PoE, US) • B012E4BWXI *[[Ruckus Wireless ZoneFlex R700]] - Dual Band 802.11ac Indoor Access Point :(3x3:3 MIMO, 802.3af PoE, 901-R700-US00) • B00MV93Q2M __NOTOC__
